description.text: Pospai is a sample application built on top of Apache Sling. Pospai is also a Romanian word that means thin layer of flour, with the added meaning of being superficial of apparent. This struck me as a good name for an application that tried to touch on many aspects of Apache Sling, but does not go in depth into any of them.

sling_info.text: Apache Slingâ„¢ is a framework for RESTful web-applications based on an extensible content tree.

sling_info_2.text: In a nutshell, Sling maps HTTP request URLs to content resources based on the request's path, extension and selectors. Using convention over configuration, requests are processed by scripts and servlets, dynamically selected based on the current resource. This fosters meaningful URLs and resource driven request processing, while the modular nature of Sling allows for specialized server instances that include only what is needed.
